titles: The Irish hubbub, or, The English hue and crie briefly pursuing the base conditions, and most notorious offences of the vile, vaine, and wicked age, no lesse smarting then tickling : a merriment whereby to make the wise to laugh, and fooles to be angry / by  Barnaby Rich ...
author: Rich, Barnabe, 1540?-1617.
publisher: Printed for Iohn Marriot, and are to sold at his shop at the white Flower-de-luce neere Fetter-lane end in Fleet-street,
notes: Has inserted dedication and verse, dated 22 Jan. 1654.
Reproduction of original in: Magdalene College (University of Cambridge). Library.
keywords: Great Britain --  Social life and customs.
